newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian Jan-Aug state spending up, deficit down.
newsitem.headline: Belgian Jan-Aug state spending up, deficit down.

text.p: Primary spending by the Belgian federal state rose to 748.4 billion francs in the first eight months of 1996 from 743.2 billion in the year-earlier period, the Budget Ministry said on Tuesday.
Corrected for inflation, spending fell 1.2 percent, it said in a statement.

The ministry said the overall budget picture was leading to "an improvement in the global deficit" with the net borrowing requirement in the first eight months 26.1 billion francs below the equivalent 1995 level.
